iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / IMPROVING WOMEN`S AND GIRLS RIGHTS AND LEGAL EDUCATION
iati-activity.description: THE PROJECT ADDRESSES THE OPPRESSION OF RURAL WOMEN AND GIRLS IN EASTERN ZAMBIA. THE ACTIVITIES TO REACH THE PROJECT PURPOSE ARE: TRAINING OF NEW PARALEGALS, OFFERING REFRESHER COURSES TO PARALEGALS, AIRING RADIO PROGRAMMES ON HUMAN AND LEGAL RIGHTS ISSUE

iati-activity.title: Environment and Natural Management and Mainstreaming
iati-activity.description: The overall development objective is in line with the Fifth National Development Plan: to reverse damage, maintain essential environmental and biological processes, and achieve sustainability in natural resource utilisation for the benefit of the people. Programme contributes to increased relevance for the environmental and natural resources sector in national development through leadership capacity in the Ministry of Tourism, Environment and Natural Resources and the associated mainstreaming of and investment in key sector issues.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / ZNAPD Ngwena River Farming Project
iati-activity.description: Diversification and modernisation of rural farming and community development through training persons with disabilities to grow and trade bananas in order to generate income and improve the financial situation of the ZNAPD organisation.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Sustainable sanitation improvement for Madimba, Lusaka
iati-activity.description: Aims: improve environmental sanitation through use of dry toilets and waste management; improve health conditions; provide drinking water. Activities: building dry toilets in public places, schools and selected households; improving old pit-latrines; capacity building of Madimba community; training and environmental education.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Green Village Community Livelihoods
iati-activity.description: Improvement of agricultural productivity and access to market in line with sustainable development principles

iati-activity.title: Support to Broad-Based Wealth and Job Creation in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project enhances access to quality business development servicies by micro, small and medium enterprises and possibilities to create partneships .

iati-activity.title: Business Development Services for Small and Medium Enterprises
iati-activity.description: Stimulate demand for targeted BDS among the SME sector and stimulate SME BDS product development by Zambian BDS providers, creation of BDS voucher programme.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Lusaka
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Lusaka

iati-activity.title: Public Sector Management Programme
iati-activity.description: Public Sector Management Programme (PSM)is one of the tree components of the Public Sector Reform Programme. The component has four sub-components â Rightsizing, Pay reform, Performance Management, Payroll Management and Establishment Control.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Frikyrklig samverkan FS rf)
iati-activity.description: Project Addressing Problems Affecting Child-headed Homes . Project Addressing Problems Affecting Child-headed Homes

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Contribution towards the Transparency International Zambia 2007 to 2011 . TI-Z is a well known and respected NGO working on anti-corruption in Zambia. It has been very active on the public fora and has for instance worked together with the Anti-Corruption Commission and the Auditor General. Activities to be implemented under the agreement 2008-2011: - facilitate the effective operation of community awareness and Advocacy and Legal Advice Centre_ ALAC (programme officer) - increase awareness in the community through traditional leaders workshops in 3 provinces - community awareness workshops through training of community based organisations in 4 provinces - staff development training and capacity building -public outreach on how to acquire services and report corruption using ALAC

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: UNDP/ECZ: Support to the Zambian electoral cycle 2008-2011. ECZ independently manages elections in Zambia. Although the 2006 and 2008 elections in Zambia were generally considered to be successfully managed_ the ECZ (and the Department for National Registration) has continued to grapple with a series of shortcomings. This project aims to build the capacity of the ECZ well in advance for the next elections. The Embassy_s view is that it is important to focus on the long-term capacity building of the organisation rather than treat elections as _one-off events_. Support focuses on the capacity building of the ECZ_ more specifically for the strengthening of women_s participation.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Intensifying the Legal Education Programme in Mansa District Luapula Pro. Mansa District Women Development Association (MDWDA) is a membership organisation made up of twenty five (25) Area Women Development Associations (AWDA) based in Mansa district and six (6) District Women Development Associations in Luapula province_ located in northern Zambia. MDWDA_s aims to support rural women in economic_ political_ cultural and social empowerment for self-sustainability. Project focuses on: -Continued training of community based paralegals and ensuring that they effectively perform their functions -Institutional capacity building of MDWDA aimed at enhancing its ability to deliver more comprehensive_ effective and efficient paralegal services to the community.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: SPW: Sustaining school based HIV and AIDS education in Central Province. In 2002_ the Zambian Ministry of Education requested support from SPW in developing and implementing a school based HIV/AIDS education that they did not have the capacity to deliver themselves. Following a feasibility study_ SPW began operating the School HIV and AIDS Education Programme (SHEP) in Central Province in 2003. Finnish Embassy has been supporting School HIV and AIDS Programme (SHEP) in Central Province since 2005. Main activities are training of peer educators_ sensitisation of schools and communities_ deployment of peer educators in schools and implementation of activities in schools (ASRH and life skills lessons_ extra-curricular activities and clubs_ awareness raising events and festivals and youth friendly resource centres).

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Towards Equality_ Democracy and Economic Growth by IT-Education
iati-activity.description: To improve the change of information and employment by training and using information technology

iati-activity.title: Ingo Aid to the Zambian National Farmers Union
iati-activity.description: Zambia National Farmer_s Union has requested support to the implementation of its Stategic Worplan from Sweden_ Finland and the Netherlands. The Programme will be implemented during 2009 - 2013. The purpose is to improve ZNFU research capacity_ lobbying and advocacy function_ member services provision and outreach programmes as well as sustainability and organizational capacity.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (KEPA), general activities
iati-activity.description: Frame Agreement with NGO (KEPA), part that is allocated in Zambia

iati-activity.title: Support to private Sector Development Reform Programme II
iati-activity.description: Support to private Sector Development Reform Programme II.

iati-activity.title: Integrated land use Assessment (ILUA) II
iati-activity.description: Integrated Land Use Assessment (ILUA) II project is to strenghten capacity in planning and implementation of Sustainable Forest Management and Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation (REDD) through better information, capacity building, dissemination of information, and improved multisectoral dialogue. First two years (2010-2011) concentrate on effective means of dissemination of the information and multisectoral dialogues as well as improved methodological and human capacity in collecting and analyzing forest resource information for SFM, REDD monitoring and carbon inventory. Implementation of ILUA II mapping and field survey will be done in 2012 and 2013.

iati-activity.title: Institutional cooperation between environmental authorities
iati-activity.description: The Institutional Cooperation (ICI) between the Finnish Environment Institute and the Zambian environment authorities comprises of five mutually defined components: 1) Human Resource Management ) Environmental Information Management 3) Strategic Environmental Assessment 4) Biodiversity and CITES Conventions 5) Basel, Stockholm, Rotterdam Conventions. The ICI programme is planned to be implemented during 2009-2012.

iati-activity.title: ZNAPD communication and resource mobilization programme CoRe
iati-activity.description: To sthrengthen the situation of Zambian PWD through three objectives: increase the informations skills of the ZNAPD and resource generation; increase accessibility of the organisation to its members through establishing regional offices; supporting income generating activities of members and local branches.

iati-activity.title: PLARD phase II: Program for Luapula Agriculture and Rural Development
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the PLARD programme is to contribute to the development of an efficient, competetive and sustainable agricultural and rural sector, which ensures increased income and food security for the people in Luapula Province. PLARD II is a new phase of the long history of the Finnish Zambian cooperation in the agricultural sector in Luapula province.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Civil Society Biofuels Forum. The project aims at establishing a Civil Society Biofuels Forum (CSBF) consisting of Zambian NGO's, Civil Society Organisations and other interested stakeholders. The CSBF will research, monitor, facilitate, disseminate information and collaborate with the Government, Biofuels Association of Zambia and the Biofuels Industry to create a pro-poor industry that contributes to rural development and equitable economic growth in the rural parts of the country, with a particular emphasis on small scale rural producers. The CSBF will develop a strategy, based on scientific research and progress evaluation in five key sectors: (1) Government biofuels policy and expenditure (2) outgrowers schemes (3) land use and rights (4) environmental impact (5) impact on women.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Support to Zambia Land Alliance Work Plan Sep 2009 - Sep 2011. Project provides support to Zambia Land Alliance strategic plan. Objectives: To promote security of customary land and sustainable land use by poor men, women, and youths, especially in ZLA operational areas. To promote and protect the rights of displaced and potential internally displaced persons and minority groups in ZLA operational areas. To strengthen local accountability in the land administration system for the urban and rural poor in ZLA operational areas. To advocate for appropriate and timely reforms of laws and policies pertaining to land delivery and administration especially for the poor and vulnerable. To provide land related information in innovative and appropriate formats for use by stakeholders at local, national and international levels.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Zambia Honey Council - Capacity Enhancement and Service Delivery Program. The overall objective of the ZHC 2009-2010 capacity enhancement and service delivery program is to contribute to the sustainable growth/development of the Zambian honey sector, to citizensâ economic empowerment and to Zambiaâs economic development and poverty reduction goals. More specifically, the project will: Improve the quality of honey produced by Zambian bee-keepers through the adoption of the ZHC field standards by bee-keepers. Improve market access by bee-keepers through strengthened ZHC District honey associations, provision of ZHC information services and Strengthen bee-keepersâ capacity to manage their bulking centers.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: LRF: Legal Aid Project December 2009-2011. On the short term: - strengthen the governance and finance function of LRF. On the long term: 1. To provide legal assistance to indigent persons. 2. To provide litigation services to vulnerable persons. 3. To inform the public of legal and human rights more effectively. 4. To ensure that LRF operates efficiently and effectively. 5. To enhance the quality of legal aid services and programmes. 6. To strengthen collaborations and strategic partnerships.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: NAZ: digitization of nat archives and preserving of Livingstone Museum. To safeguard and ensure the preservation of the most valuable and perishable components of the archival patrimony of the National Archives of Zambia through digitization. Establishment of National Archives of Zambia as a digital portal of knowledge and preserving Livingstone Museumâs archival patrimony.

iati-activity.title: Investment-related loan through Finnfund
iati-activity.description: Investment-related loan through Finnfund, Agribusiness.

iati-activity.title: Monitoring and evaluation capacity building to Ministry of Agriculture
iati-activity.description: The programme aims to improve the availability and timeliness of relevant food security and agriculture sector information in Zambia, while strengthening the monitoring and evaluation system and coordination role of the Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives (MACO). The main objectives are that MACO is better able to perform its sector coordination function at local level, to provide timely and quality food security information, and to monitor its performance and that of other stakeholders more effectively, through the production of data that contributes to evidence based decision making, either through administrative reporting systems or through surveys. The programme supports monitoring and evaluation of the Programme for Luapula Agricultural and Rural Development (PLARD) and it is implemented under the IFAD Smallholder Agribusiness Promotion Programme (SAPP) in 2011 and 2012.

iati-activity.title: TK/institutional cooperation between Geological Surveys
iati-activity.description: A detailed analysis of the existing data and of the status of geo-information system, GIS and RS facilities (including hardware and software) at the GSD and GD-SOM-UNZA. Assessment of available human resources, their knowledge and skills in using GIS and RS and the need for training. GSD and GD-SOM-UNZA staff attend training organised as short courses in GIS and RS and as on-the-job training in data digitalization and field data capture. Lectures on GIS and RS applications in geosciences are open to all university students.

iati-activity.title: Poverty Reduction Budget Support
iati-activity.description: Based on the Finnish Development Policy Programme and the 2010 policy paper on General Budget Support and Sector Budget Support, budget support complements Finland's other development cooperation efforts. Budget support is implemented based on the memorandum of understanding with Zambia and progress is evaluated based on the indicators of the budget support performance assessment framework together with implementation of the key principles of budget support. Zambia is an LDC country with every possibility to climb to the lower middle income country category. Zambia needs predictable and effective development cooperation during this transition period. Continuing Finland's budget support for the following two years is in this situation the right way to implement the partnership between Zambia and Finland.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project aims at enhancing the local economy in the Kafinda Game Management Area through improved management and sustainable use of natural resources. More specifically, the project will: 1. Promote democracy and gender equality in the process of community development 2. Assist the community to continue to build capacities for sustainable management of natural resources 3. Consolidate previous training that has enabled the community to begin adopting sustainable methods of income generation and food production 4. Enhance the awareness of the benefits of the conservation education and sustainable development 5. Promote human rights and HIV/AIDS awareness in the community 6. Help reduce poverty, food insecurity and dependence through income generation activities on self-help basis.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the project is to conduct an empirically based longitudinal analysis of the dynamics of constituency political developments over a 20-month period in the run-up to the 2011 elections. The main focus will be on party strategy and behaviour and on inter- and intra-party relations. The study will be conducted by a team of neutral academic researchers and the help of carefully selected research assistants.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project aims to create significant advancement in the human rights of people with disabilities in Zambia. The purpose is to establish principles, precedents and better practice which achieve improved rights of persons with disabilities notably around key issues/themes of access, education, employment laws, and HIV/AIDS. Project activities include: 1. Casework, support and outreach 2. Litigation components a) Accessibility audits b) Strategic litigation 3. Advocacy and awareness raising 4. Building a template for replication. Project will be implemented in Western and North Western province of Zambia.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project objectives are: 1. To establish sustainable community social auditing systems in Chipata District as a tool for tracking Constituency Development Fund expenditure by 2012, 2. To enhance support for planning and implementation of relevant community-owned CDF-funded projects where impacts are visible and therefore better future management of CDF funds, 3. To establish sustainable linkages between the community in Chipata district and active stakeholders in addressing governance accountability, corruption and abuse of public funds for enhanced governance accountability and community participation at all levels of public expenditure by 2014, 4. To document and share the experiences of social auditing in Chipata district which will inform CDFA public policy engagement for more evidence-based policy engagement by 2014 and beyond.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Objectives include: 1. To increase the communityâs participation in the fight against corruption, 2. To improve peopleâs input and participation in policy formulation, 3. To strengthen community watchdog groups on usage and utilization of resources, Through following activities: 1. Live Radio Good Governance, 2. Democracy and Governance cruise, 3. Citizens Forums, 4. Press Committee Meetings

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: To build the capacity of CSBF to enable the network to produce scientific information on the impact of biofuels industry on land rights and environment, increase knowledge of civil society on biofuels and increase number of stakeholders involved in the biofuels sector.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project is aimed at building capacity of state and non-state actors (especially at the grassroots) in order to strengthen and influence participation in the EIF process and contains activities of three kinds: capacity building, research and advocacy.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Production of two TV documentaries to preserve and showcase Zambia's rich music and pre-historic traditions, using ZNBC music archives for the first and documenting current archeological excavations for the latter.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: The project entails support to the Sekute Community Development Trust for capacity building and the establishment of a sports fishing camp in Southern province.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Zambia
iati-activity.description: Intensifying the Legal Education Programme in Mansa District Luapula Pro. Mansa District Women Development Association (MDWDA) is a membership organisation made up of twenty five (25) Area Women Development Associations (AWDA) based in Mansa district and

iati-activity.title: Enhancing the opportunities for African children to learn to read
iati-activity.description: The use of local phonetic languages is strengthened by piloting a new ict-based method and a mobile learning game in Zambian basic education context.

iati-activity.title: Public Expenditure Management and Financial Accountability
iati-activity.description: Public Expenditure Management and Financial Accountability

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )

iati-activity.title: Support for the Expansion of Social Protection Programmes
iati-activity.description: The programme aims to intensify the impact of Finland's development efforts within the primary goal of the development policy programme, poverty eradication, and in the cross-cutting themes of gender equality and vulnerable groups. At the same time, the programme supports the efforts of Zambia to attain the status of a middle-income country, where extreme poverty has been eradicated. It aims to reduce poverty, hunger and chronic malnutrition especially in the rural areas by implementing previously succesfully piloted family grant and child grant models and developing employment pension and social pension schemes. The programme also strengthens the capacities of the Ministry of Community Development and Social Services (MCDSS) and Ministry of Labour and Social Security (MLSS) implementing the programme. The programme has potential to evolve into a sectoral budget support programme.

iati-activity.title: Support to Zambian government officials visit
iati-activity.description: Support to the visit of the Zambian government officials in Finland. Support through the Ministry of Environment.
